section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: In this Schedule—chairperson (主席) means the chairperson of the Council referred to in section 9(1)(a) of this Ordinance; (Added 17 of 2012 s. 62)member (成員) means a member of the Council referred to in section 9(1) of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a meeting of the Council shall be held at such time and place as the chairperson may appoint. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 62)
The Council shall meet if there is a notice in writing, signed by not less than half of its members, requesting that a meeting be held.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Notice of meetings
section.content: Unless otherwise determined by the chairperson, a notice of meeting shall be served on each member at least 14 days before the day on which the meeting is to be held.

subsection.content: At a meeting of the Council, a quorum is not less than half of its members.

If a member is disqualified from taking part in a decision or deliberation in respect of a matter under section 6, he shall be disregarded for the purposes of constituting the quorum for deciding or deliberating on that matter.
Subject to subsection (2), the chairperson is to preside at a meeting of the Council.
If, for any reason, the chairperson is not able to preside at a meeting of the Council, the members present at the meeting are to elect a member from among themselves to preside.

All questions for determination are to be decided by a majority of votes of the members present and voting, and if there is an equality of votes, the member presiding has a casting vote in addition to his or her original vote.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Disclosure of interests of members
section.leadIn: If a member has a pecuniary interest, whether direct or indirect, in any matter under consideration at a meeting of the Council, the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall, as soon as practicable after the commencement of the meeting, disclose to the Council the fact and nature of his interest;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall withdraw from the meeting while the Council is considering the matter, if so required by the meeting; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not in any case vote on the matter.

subsection.content: The Council is to establish and maintain a register for the purpose of keeping a record of any disclosure made by a member.
The Council may determine the form of the register, including the manner of making entries in it.

After a disclosure is made by a member, the Council is to cause the name of that member and the particulars of the disclosure to be recorded in the register; if a further disclosure is made, the Council is to cause those particulars to be recorded in the register after such disclosure is made.

For the purpose of enabling any member of the public to ascertain the particulars of the disclosure made by a member, the Council is to make available the register for inspection by the public at any reasonable time.

subsection.def: In this section, disclosure (披露) means a disclosure of pecuniary interest required to be made under section 6.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Validity of proceedings
section.leadIn: The validity of any proceedings of the Council shall not be affected by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any defect in the appointment of a member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any vacancy in the membership of the Council.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Meetings of Council to be held in public

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a meeting of the Council shall be open to the public.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to a meeting of the Council or a part of a meeting of the Council in the following circumstances—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if, in the opinion of the Council, it is likely that the application of subsection (1) would result—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in premature release of information concerning any financial matter or investment of the Council; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in a disclosure of information in breach of any law, order or direction of a court or tribunal, duty of confidentiality, or other legal obligation or duty;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if, in the opinion of the Council, it is likely that any matter to be discussed or considered at the meeting or part of the meeting—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: concerns a particular case that involves the carrying out of any provision of this Ordinance relating to the levy, surcharge, penalty or further penalty; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Council, having regard to all the circumstances of a particular case, reasonably considers that subsection (1) should not apply to the meeting or part of the meeting.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Council to determine procedures
section.content: Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Council may determine its own procedures.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 2(2) and this section, any business that may be transacted by a resolution of the Council in a meeting may be validly transacted, without a meeting, by a resolution in writing if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the resolution is signed and endorsed by more than half of the eligible members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is so signed and endorsed within the specified period.

subsection.content: If a resolution is in the form of more than one document, the requirements of subsection (1)(a) are to be regarded as satisfied if each document is in the like form and the documents together bear the signatures of, and have been endorsed by, more than half of the eligible members.
A telex, cable or facsimile, or an electronically transmitted document, that bears the signature of an eligible member is to be regarded as signed by that member.
A resolution in the form of more than one document is to be regarded as made on the date on which the resolution is signed by the last member to sign and endorse it within the specified period.

A member may, within the specified period, give notice in writing to the chairperson requiring that the business to which the resolution relates be transacted at a meeting of the Council. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 62)

subsection.leadIn: Where a notice is given under subsection (5), the following applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the business to which the resolution relates may not be transacted in the manner described in subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a resolution for the purposes of subsection (1) may not be made or regarded as having been made.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—
subsection.def: eligible member (合資格成員) means a member who, on the date on which the resolution is made, is entitled to attend and vote at a meeting of the Council in respect of the business;
endorse (同意), in relation to a resolution, includes to endorse the transaction of the business by a resolution without a meeting of the Council;

def.name: SpecifiedPeriod
def.leadIn: specified period (指明期間), in relation to any business referred to in subsection (1), means a period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is determined by the chairperson and specified in the documents circulated for the purposes of transacting the business; and (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 62)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within which a member may indicate to the Council as to whether he endorses the resolution.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Board member (訓練委員會成員) means a member of the Training Board referred to in section 2; (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 63)
chairperson (主席) means the chairperson of the Training Board appointed under section 2(4). (Added 17 of 2012 s. 63)

subsection.content: The Training Board is to consist of 14 members appointed by the Council.

subsection.leadIn: Of those members—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: 3 are to be persons who, in the opinion of the Council, represent contractors in the construction industry;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: 3 are to be persons who, in the opinion of the Council, are from trade unions representing workers employed in the construction industry that are registered under the Trade Unions Ordinance (Cap. 332);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: one is to be such other person as the Council thinks fit to be a member of the Training Board; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: 2 are to be public officers.

subsection.content: The Council may not appoint a public officer under subsection (2)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e).
The Council is to appoint a Board member to be the chairperson of the Training Board.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Term of office of Board member who is not public officer

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a Board member who is not a public officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds office for a period determined by the Council; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is eligible for reappointment on the expiry of his term of office.

subsection.content: A Board member who is not a public officer may not serve as such a member continuously for more than 6 years.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Resignation of Board member who is not public officer

subsection.content: A Board member who is not a public officer may resign at any time by giving notice in writing to the Council.
A resignation takes effect on the date specified in the notice of resignation or, if a date is not specified, on the date the Council receives the notice.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Holding of meetings
section.content: A meeting of the Training Board shall be held at such time and place as the chairperson may appoint.

subsection.content: At a meeting of the Training Board, a quorum is not less than 6 Board members. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 63)

If a Board member is disqualified from taking part in a decision or deliberation in respect of a matter under section 8, he shall be disregarded for the purposes of constituting the quorum for deciding or deliberating on that matter.
Subject to subsection (2), the chairperson is to preside at a meeting of the Training Board.
If, for any reason, the chairperson is not able to preside at a meeting of the Training Board, the Board members present at the meeting are to elect a member from among themselves to preside.
All questions for determination are to be decided by a majority of votes of the Board members present and voting.
If there is an equality of votes, the member presiding has a casting vote in addition to his or her original vote.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Disclosure of interests of Board members
section.leadIn: If a Board member has a pecuniary interest, whether direct or indirect, in any matter under consideration at a meeting of the Training Board, the member— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 63)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall, as soon as practicable after the commencement of the meeting, disclose to the Training Board the fact and nature of his interest;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall withdraw from the meeting while the Training Board is considering the matter, if so required by the meeting; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not in any case vote on the matter.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Validity of proceedings
section.leadIn: The validity of any proceedings of the Training Board shall not be affected by— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 63)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any defect in the appointment of a Board member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any vacancy in the membership of the Training Board. (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 63)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Training Board to determine procedures
section.content: Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Training Board may determine its own procedures.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Delegation of Training Board’s functions and appointment of subcommittee

subsection.content: The Training Board may appoint any subcommittee as it considers appropriate.
The Training Board may delegate in writing any of its functions to a subcommittee appointed under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The Training Board may not delegate under subsection (2) any of the following powers— (Amended 17 of 2012 s. 63)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the power to appoint a subcommittee under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the power to delegate under subsection (2);

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the power to authorize the preparation of its accounts or other financial records.

subsection.content: A delegation may be subject to such terms and conditions as the Training Board considers fit.
A delegation does not prevent the concurrent performance by the Training Board of the functions delegated.
The Training Board may amend or revoke a delegation.

In every financial year, the Training Board shall submit to the Council, before a date determined by the Council, a programme of its proposed activities and estimates of its income and expenditure for the next financial year.
The Training Board shall submit the programme and estimates for the first financial year as soon as practicable after the commencement of this section.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Accounts of the Training Board and submission of reports, etc. to Council

subsection.content: The Training Board shall maintain proper accounts and records of all its income and expenditure.
The Training Board shall, as soon as practicable after the end of a financial year, cause to be prepared a statement of accounts of the Training Board in respect of the financial year.
The statement of accounts is to include an income and expenditure account and a balance sheet.

The Training Board shall submit to the Council, before a date determined by the Council, a report on the activities of the Training Board during the financial year and a copy of the statement of accounts referred to in subsection (2).

part.name: P2

part.content: 0.5% of the value of the construction operations concerned. (Amended L.N. 133 of 2012)
